messages.message:
Craig
Nice good to hear that im just chilling working on site
What refinements you doing

Condor
Currently some bluetooth speakers that I found in a local store that I'm placing everywhere in the house now.. Problem is that they have this annoying AF Chinese voice so I'm thinking of replacing the controller with an Arduino
Also my bike is receiving some upgrades.. Gonna integrate one of my Raspberry Pi's in it to power the lights intelligently, based on time of day and proximity of my smartphone

Biprodeep
It will be interesting to note, how long it takes for ALSA and KRACK patches to roll out via repos.

Condor
I wonder about that too actually.. Let's make some predictions!
I think it'll arrive in less than a week

Biprodeep
KRACK has unofficially been rolled out by wpa_supplicant maintainers, they didn't just yet put it into their dev tree, once they do it, it will take around a day to get the update.
Regarding ALSA it has yet to be patched and is a severe kernel bug that can be exploit to escalate privilege.
ALSA might take a week or more.

Condor
That's why I presume it'll be patched fast
Last time that Dirty Cow thing didn't take a whole lot of time to get patched in upstream either
Btw got any news on the Blueborne vulnerabilities? I haven't been following up with it recently

Biprodeep
They have been patched I guess. Haven't check the release updates for them.

Condor
Hmm, I see ðŸ¤”
Currently printing the white paper btw. Looks interesting
